FeedItems.Summary: NuGet 1.0 was released on January 13th, 2011 ‚Äì 10 years and 4 major version releases ago. Since then, NuGet.org has grown to host a large and vibrant package ecosystem with over 230 thousand unique...

FeedItems.Title: Getting Started With NuGet 5.8
FeedItems.Summary:
Getting started with NuGet 5.8
NuGet 5.8 is included in Visual Studio 16.8 and .NET 5.0 out of the box. You can also download NuGet 5.8 for Windows, macOS, and Linux as a standalone executable.

* Modified logic to upload/display embedded readme

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot access to the account in any way" (#8408) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### I lost the access to the main account on Nuget

I no longer have access to the email address associated with the account they used to publish the packages.

The domain has expired.

Please, can you help me to recover it?

Thank you.

Ensure there is an opt-out.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot connect account with work Microsoft account" (#8394) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi Nuget team!

Can you please assist me with my problem? I'm trying to create an account in Nuget.org and link it with work Microsoft account
Somehow I have created login+password account and now I'm getting this window:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30490978/105715159-4e328480-5f2e-11eb-98bb-aa1a7a80e3d1.png)

I\m understand that is correct behaviour of the site, because login+pass Auth has beem discontinued. When I am trying to log in with Mircosoft after choosing my accnount I'm getting this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30490978/105715347-8a65e500-5f2e-11eb-914f-811f0ceb242f.png)

I am expected to be logged in Nuget.org site, but got Need admin approval error. First, I tried to find person in company that related to creating Nuget accounts but no one knows about it inside company. 

I hope that you can help with this problem, 
Thanks
Andrey

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "get download statistic for my organization packages with API" (#8396) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi!
Marketing team in my organization is wondering if there is a way to get download statistic automatically?
We push packages to nuget.org using your API, do you have any method to get package info, including download statistic?
For package we need:
1. Total downloads
2. Unique IP Address Downloads

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add E2E test for vulnerability" (#7654) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- Create a dummy "Vulnerability" record and "VulnerablePackageVersionRange" that applies to all versions of "E2E.Vulnerable".
- Create an E2E test that checks that the package was marked vulnerable in registration as expected.
- Update other E2E tests to verify that the package being fetched does not have vulnerability metadata.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Cleanup Proposals for Repository" (#10525) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This PR cleans up the existing proposals & unifies the wiki proposals into one place.

It talks about the proposal process & paves a way for managing proposals moving forward.

This is a follow-up regarding the fostering OSS efforts to drive contribution & transparency to the community.

Please feel free to provide feedback so we can make this experience wonderful moving forward for us & the community.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "when a solution" (#10524) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "when a solution" (#10524) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Improve PMUI experience when another Project has errors" (#10523) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:  No

When a project is in some broken state (eg, failed to load), PMUI for another, valid project, should either block all actions, or even better, it should just allow actions to work for the valid project. 

## Repro steps and/or sample project

See https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10522

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "When a solution with all PackageReference projects, has a project that has bad data, the PM UI is unusable" (#10522) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 

## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->

1. Create 2 different SDK based projects.
2. To project 1, add a PackageReference with a broken version, for example: `<PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.json" Version="badVersion" />`
3. Open project 2 and try to do *any* action with the PM UI. There's *nothing* happening. 
4. The error list in 16.10 *does* contain a NuGet specific error for the other project(16.9, you will get an error that the assets file is not created for project 1). Either way, it might not be immediately obvious why it fails. 

Note that there's a restore side to this as well. When dealing with bad data, NuGet *must* write an assets file to create the errors that project 1 gets. 

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Debian-based OSes" (#49) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hey Everyone,

Our preliminary investigation shows that .NET 5 restore is broken for Debian-based operating systems including Docker thus resulting in error messages like:

```
error NU3037: Package 'System.Memory 4.5.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
```

### [Debian Versions](https://www.debian.org/releases/)
- We're currently aware that Debian 10 ("buster") and earlier versions are affected. ‚ùå
- We do know that Debian testing ("bullseye") and later are not affected. ‚úî

This is because of an [issue reported](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=962596) in the `ca-certificates` package in which the root CA being used are not trusted and must be installed manually due to [Symantec Issues](https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:Symantec_Issues). Because this issue has been resolved recently in version 20210119 of this package, it is not available in a Debian version as provided in `dotnet-docker` for `buster-slim` today.

## Workarounds

- Manually update the [ca-certificates](https://packages.debian.org/bullseye/ca-certificates) package to version 20210119 including a `bullseye` or later version.
- Consider using a different Debian-based Docker image such as `alpine` or `focal`.
 
## Solution

We're currently working to update the `dotnet-docker`'s `buster-slim` image to update the `ca-certificates` package to 20210119 that resolves this issue. We are however currently verifying this is a viable solution with no large diffs between the `buster` and `bullseye` releases.

Additionally, the `ca-certificates` package is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive which will promote this fix to the `buster` release in the next few days to which an updated `buster-slim` image will be prepared and released when available.

## Stay Updated

- We are continuing to investigate this issue and will let you know more as we find out.
- We'll continue to update the discussion at https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10491.
- We will also continue posting updates on https://status.nuget.org and on Twitter @NuGet.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
